messages.message: @Chetan are you still getting the apache/thrift errors with go services? I've been unable to get around them
Until/unless https://git.apache.org comes back up, our builds are kinda screwed. Heymian and I were talking about using a caching GOPROXY to fix this in the future, but it doesn't help us now.
looks like it went back up ~2hrs ago? https://status.apache.org/
yup. just started working on other stuff waiting for apache to figure itself out @Ted

not “blocked” per se (working on moving other tickets from “in progress” to “in review”), but a few more days and we’ll be blocked on VR integration until apache is able to resolve (unless we want to merge without actually testing it locally).
I still see it as down on that page, and I can’t connect to git.apache.org:443 (http://git.apache.org:443) at all.

Oh I see. i scrolled down to the section on “Past Incidents”
```
JIRA (issues.apache.org (http://issues.apache.org)) is experiencing issues.
Resolved - service has been restored. 
Sep 4, 17:08 UTC
```
lemme start looking at go 1.13 release notes… it came out < 24hrs ago

Ah, OK! Sorry if this was already discussed and I missed it. Helpful to know best course of action is to just work on other things though! Can def do that until apache comes back alive (...as ZOMBIE APACHE)
aaaand they are back down again?
There were never back up, afaict.
I had a build succeed once
I was so excited!
Ooh. That must have been nice!
I will say that my inability to connect to port 443 for them is a different error than it was before. So if they aren’t making progress, they’re at least changing _something_…
lol it seems really flakey. my mount-service built, but my repo-service didn’t.
i have a workaround for this in case apache decides to stay dead
Works like a champ! Thank you so much for that, @Heymian
They actually stopped using the apache mirror in their own source code. They changed it to github as well, but since our version is sooo old we don’t have that luxury.
/me adds “look into seeing how hard it would be to upgrade thrift” to his ever-growing todo list…
uh what's the workaround?
https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/10986
